      • getNextCell

        public Cell getNextCell(Cell cell,
               int direction,
               boolean isOccupied)
        Given a cell on the board and a direction, this function will return the next cell in the direction specified relative to the given cell. If isOccupied is set, it will return the first cell that has a tile. Otherwise, it will return the first cell without a tile. The purpose of this method is for keyboard accessibility. If the user has not "grabbed" a tile with the keyboard, and he or she presses an arrow key, we want to highlight the next legal tile on the board in the direction of the arrow key relative to the currently highlighted tile. If the user has grabbed a tile, we need to find the next empty cell in that direction to place the tile in. The strategy taken at this time is thus: ideally, the function tries to find an eligible cell in it's own row/col (depending on the direction). If it can't, it searches the adjacent rows/cols, and continues to do so outward, alternating between sides.
        Parameters:
        cell - The currently highlighted/grabbed cell
        direction - The direction to search the board relative to the cell
        isOccupied - Whether or not we are looking for a cell with a tile
        Returns:
        The next cell in that direction relative to the given cell

      • extractAdjacentWordCells

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Cell>> extractAdjacentWordCells(java.util.Hashtable<BoardLocation,Cell> placedTileCells)
        extractAdjacentWordCells takes a hash table of newly placed tiles and determines what potential words they are being used in, it returns an array of cell arrays containing all of the cells involved with new words
        Parameters:
        placedTileCells - Cells containing tiles placed by the player this turn
        Returns:
        Hash tabled of potential word cells

      • formWordsFromCells

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> formWordsFromCells(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Cell>> wordCells)
        formWordsFromCells takes an array of cell arrays and determines the words that each cell array forms
        Parameters:
        wordCells - Cells containing potential words
        Returns:
        ArrayList of words formed by the cells
